programme.title: The Crash Reel
programme.desc: Kevin Pearce was an American snowboarder who became a star in the world of extreme sports, and an athlete who lived for the adrenaline rush of catching air on the half-pipe. Pearce seemed a sure bet to make the 2010 Winter Olympic team, but that all changed in 2009, when during training exercises in Park City, Utah, he miscalculated and suffered an accident that left him with a traumatic brain injury. Pearce had always been close to his family, and they rallied to his side as he went through grueling rehabilitation while recovering from his injuries. But when Pearce made it clear one of his first priorities was to get back on the half-pipe and someday return to competition, he discovered his loved ones were united against him, not wanting to see him suffer another accident that could be even more costly. Filmmaker Lucy Walker tells the story of Kevin Pearce and his long road to recovery, and also explores the dangers of a popular but very risky sport, in the documentary The Crash Reel. The film received its world premiere at the 2013 Sundance Film Festival

programme.title: Jumper
programme.desc: Superb special effects propel this mind-bending sci-fi trip about a young man (Hayden Christensen) with the power to teleport himself anywhere on the planet. Life is a blast for him, until the arrival of a mysterious tracker (Samuel L. Jackson) from a secret society that is out to capture his kind and others like him. Directed by Doug Liman and written by David S. Goyer, Jim Uhls and Simon Kinberg, who adapted the script from Steven Gould's young-adult best sellers "Jumper" and "Exile."

programme.title: The Transporter
programme.desc: An outlaw finds his life becoming all the more dangerous when he turns against a gang of criminals in this action drama. Frank Martin (Jason Statham) is a former Special Forces officer who lives on the French Mediterranean and has a lucrative second career as a underworld courier for hire. Martin will deliver anything anywhere, but he has three iron-clad rules - once the plan is in motion it cannot be changed, neither he nor his customers are to ever use their real names, and under no circumstances will he open the package. Martin is hired to make a delivery to a wealthy but unscrupulous American known as Wall Street (Matt Schulze), but after taking possession of the package he realizes that whatever is inside happens to be alive. Breaking his own rule, Martin opens the bag to discover a beautiful Asian woman, Lai (Shu Qi), who is bound and gagged. Lai briefly escapes, but Martin captures her, and delivers her to Wall Street as promised. However, after being given a parcel to deliver by Wall Street, Martin finds out what Wall Street is up to - in partnership with Lai's father Mr. Kwai (Ric Young), Wall Street is part of a scheme to smuggle Asian illegal aliens into France. Martin's conscience gets the better of him, and he sets out to rescue Lai and put Wall Street and Mr. Kwai out of business; however, as if this wasn't enough of a challenge, Martin discovers a French detective, Tarconi (Francois Berleand) has gotten wind of his illegal business. The Transporter was the first English-language feature for Hong Kong-based director Corey Yuen, who along with directing a number of HK action flicks designed fight choreography for several American films

programme.desc: Benicio Del Toro, Dennis Farina, Brad Pitt, Jason Statham, Alan Ford, Vinnie Jones. Violent comedy crime caper revolving around three groups of villains intent on retrieving a missing diamond. Two friends team up with a pugilistic gypsy to fix a boxing match, but their opponent also arranges some dodgy betting with the courier of the stolen diamond, who subsequently goes missing. When a gangster from New York arrives on the scene, things become really complicated(n)

programme.title: The Salton Sea
programme.desc: Danny Parker is a crystal meth addict in LA, hanging out with his junkie friends and earning money on the side as an informant. In a world where parties go on for days and they frequently can't tell whether it's night or day, Danny questions whether these people are his real friends. But is Danny everything he seems? Starring Val Kilmer, Vincent D'Onofrio, Peter Sarsgaard, Adam Goldberg, Doug Hutchison, Anthony LaPaglia(n)

programme.title: State and Main
programme.desc: Echoing the themes of Living in Oblivion and Irma Vep, David Mamet's seventh feature centers on the havoc wrought on the inhabitants of a small town by a troubled film production. After its leading man's propensity for teenage girls gets them banished from their New Hampshire location, a film crew relocates to the small town of Waterford, VT, to finish shooting "The Old Mill." As its title suggests, the film depends on the presence of a genuine mill, something the town is reported to possess. Unfortunately, with only days before principal photography begins, it becomes apparent that the mill in fact burned down decades ago. Unfazed, the film's director, Walt Price (William H. Macy), places his faith in the ability of first-time screenwriter Joseph Turner White (Philip Seymour Hoffman) to alter the script; what he doesn't count on is White's apparently bottomless reserve of angst-fueled writer's block. The film's leading lady (Sarah Jessica Parker) refuses to do her contracted nude scene unless she's give an ungodly sum of cash, while a foreign cinematographer offends the locals by messing with an historic firehouse, and the leading man, Bob Barrenger (Alec Baldwin), dallies with Carla (Julia Stiles), a crafty local teen. Everything comes to a head after Barrenger and Carla are injured in a car accident, which leads White to another emotional quandary and into the arms of Ann Black (Rebecca Pidgeon)(n)

programme.title: Making of 'The Danish Girl'
programme.desc: A look at "The Danish Girl," a 2015 adaptation of David Ebershoff's novel about early 20th-century Danish painter Einar Wegener, who was one of the first people to have sex-reassignment surgery. The film stars Eddie Redmayne, Alicia Vikander and Matthias Schoenaerts, and is directed by Tom Hooper(n)

programme.title: Vice

programme.title: Alvin and the Chipmunks
programme.desc: Three musical chipmunks are discovered by a failing songwriter, who writes them a number one hit. They're signed by a big shot record label executive, but fame and fortune isn't all it was cracked up to be for the woodland critters(n)

programme.title: Barbershop
programme.desc: Calvin (Ice Cube) never wanted to take over the family business, a barbershop on the south side of Chicago. Disgusted with the shop's crime-ridden neighborhood, and caught up in his moneymaking schemes, one morning Calvin decides to sell the shop to the shady Lester (Keith David). Chastised by his pregnant wife, Jennifer (Jazsmin Lewis), for his rash decision, Calvin spends the day cutting heads at the shop, and starts to understand the importance of the legacy his grandfather and father have left to him. The bickering barbers include Eddie (Cedric the Entertainer), the old-timer with his own unique perspective on black life; Terri (rapper Eve in her film debut), a hot-tempered woman with a trifling boyfriend; Jimmy (Sean Patrick Thomas), a college educated snob; Ricky (Michael Ealy) a reformed criminal; Isaac (Troy Garity, the son of Jane Fonda and Tom Hayden), a white B-Boy, whom no one is ready to let cut their hair; and Dinka (Leonard Howze), a recent African immigrant who's too shy to express his feelings for Terri. Calvin learns to appreciate them all, and discovers that the place where they work is more than just a place to get a haircut -- it's a meeting place for the neighborhood, a place where folks can speak their minds and find out what's happening. Calvin gradually changes his mind about selling the shop, but it may be too late. Meanwhile, a bumbling thief, J.D. (Anthony Anderson) spends a painful day trying to crack open the ATM he's stolen from the grocery store across the street. Barbershop was directed by Tim Story and produced by George Tillman Jr. and Robert Teitel, the producers of Soul Food. Barbershop had its world premiere at the 2002 Urbanworld Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Super Troopers
programme.desc: A handful of state troopers are put in the uncomfortable position of having to actually enforce the law in this high-spirited comedy. Mac (Steve Lemme), Thorny (Jay Chandrasekhar), Foster (Paul Stoter), and Rabbit (Erik Stolhanske) are four Vermont state troopers whose dedication to duty is not exactly an inspiration to law enforcement officers everywhere. Stationed in a small town near the Canadian border, the troopers don't have much to do, so they while away their hours smoking dope and harassing hapless motorists. Their superior officer, Capt. O'Hagan (Brian Cox), likes the boys and they try to keep their more outrageous antics out of his earshot, but they often run afoul of fellow trooper Farva (Kevin Heffernan), who insists on doing things by the book. When Governor Jessman (Lynda Carter) announces massive budget cuts for Vermont law enforcement personnel, things look bad for the troopers and they must quickly prove their worth or they'll be forced to look for real jobs. Appropriately enough, the troopers stumble upon some information regarding a group of marijuana dealers operating along the border; the guys figure this is just the sort of high-profile bust that could save their careers, but the police department of a nearby town gets wind of the troopers' plans. The Earlville police are no friends of the troopers, and they set out to ruin their moment of glory. Super Troopers was written by the five-man comedy troupe Broken Lizard, who also star as the five troopers; the group's leader, Jay Chandrasekhar, directed(n)

programme.title: 27 Dresses
programme.desc: Wedding mania gets a comic spin in the tale of Jane (Katherine Heigl), who's always a bridesmaid and never a bride. Jane's passion for all things nuptial is tested when she's asked to plan her sister's wedding to the man she secretly loves. A cynical columnist (James Marsden) who falls for Jane while surreptitiously writing a human-interest story about her further complicates Jane's dreams of love and marriage(n)

programme.title: The Banger Sisters
programme.desc: Goldie Hawn and Susan Sarandon star in this giddy comedy about former rock groupies who reunite decades after their wild antics. Hawn plays the freewheeling Suzette, who is shocked to find her pal Lavinia (Sarandon) is a proper housewife living in suburbia. Geoffrey Rush, Erika Christensen, Eva Amurri, Robin Thomas(n)

programme.title: Entourage
programme.desc: Movie star Vincent Chase makes his directorial debut, but runs into trouble when he goes over budget in this raunchy satire of Hollywood. Meanwhile, E prepares for the birth of his child, Johnny Drama seeks a breakout role and Turtle tries to woo MMA fighter Ronda Rousey. Based on the HBO series(n)

programme.title: Zero Effect
programme.desc: This cleverly constructed detective thriller stars Bill Pullman as Daryl Zero, a man whose eccentric and reclusive nature does not stop him functioning as one of the best detectives in the business. Hired to discover who is behind a blackmailing operation, Zero's investigation becomes too thorough for his client's liking, revealing a trail of lies and deception that leads to.well, that would be telling. The intricate plot is packed with surprises and the richly realised characters will keep you engrossed(n)

programme.title: D.C. Cab
programme.desc: A scruffy taxi company is about to be wiped out when its owner exhorts his cabbies to do what they can to help save the company, and what they can do turns out to be a surprise to everyone concerned(n)

programme.title: Connie and Carla
programme.desc: Two women are forced to go on the run after witnessing a brutal crime. Seeking refuge as entertainers they find the kind of success they always dreamed of(n)

programme.title: Spy
programme.desc: After years of doing work integral to the success of major missions, an intelligent but self-conscious deskbound CIA analyst (Melissa McCarthy) is finally given the chance to go undercover as a homely "cat lady" in order to save her missing partner (Jude Law) and thwart a global disaster at the hands of a dangerous arms dealer. Written and directed by Paul Feig(n)

programme.title: Entourage
programme.desc: Movie star Vincent Chase makes his directorial debut, but runs into trouble when he goes over budget in this raunchy satire of Hollywood. Meanwhile, E prepares for the birth of his child, Johnny Drama seeks a breakout role and Turtle tries to woo MMA fighter Ronda Rousey. Based on the HBO series(n)

programme.title: The Man From U.N.C.L.E.
programme.desc: In this spy thriller set in the early 1960s, CIA agent Napoleon Solo and KGB operative Illya Kuryakin team up to stop an international criminal organisation that is trafficking nuclear weapons and technology. Adaptation of the TV series of the same name(n)

programme.title: Snakes on a Plane
programme.desc: An FBI agent takes on a plane full of deadly and poisonous snakes, deliberately released to kill a witness being flown from Honolulu to Los Angeles to testify against a mob boss(n)

programme.title: The Fabulous Baker Boys
programme.desc: Real-life siblings Beau and Jeff Bridges star as the eponymous Fabulous Baker Boys. Musical prodigies both, the Bakers have long been teamed as a twin-piano act, with the less talented Frank (Beau Bridges) coasting on the skills of his brilliant younger brother, Jack (Jeff Bridges). Their career dwindling to nickel-and-dime dates in second-rate clubs, the Bakers decide that they need a female vocalist to boost their popularity. They select auditioner Susie Diamond (Michelle Pfeiffer), who in addition to being a gifted songstress is drop-dead gorgeous. The newly renovated Baker Boys act scores a success, which is inevitably threatened by Susie's growing popularity and by Jack's insistence upon pursuing an affair with the girl(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Spy'
programme.desc: A look at "Spy," a 2015 comedy about a CIA analyst thrust into the line of duty to track down a ruthless arms dealer. The film stars Melissa McCarthy, Jason Statham and Rose Byrne, and is written and directed by Paul Feig(n)

programme.title: Club Paradise
programme.desc: A fireman uses disability money to open a Caribbean resort and tries to hide the destination's many problems when the first set of tourists arrive(n)

programme.title: The Dream Team
programme.desc: Mental patients fly the cuckoo's nest for a fling in the Big Apple, and are soon followed by a group of low-rent criminals(n)

programme.title: Frankie and Johnny
programme.desc: Based on a popular off-Broadway play by Terrence McNally, this drama chronicles the bittersweet romance between an ex-con who gets a job slinging hash at a local greasy spoon and the misanthropic plain-Jane waitress who works there(n)

programme.title: Juno
programme.desc: (2007) Jason Reitman's comedy drama stars Oscar-nominee Ellen Page as Juno McGuff, 16 and pregnant after an encounter with sometime boyfriend Paulie Bleeker (Michael Cera). She tells her father Mac and stepmother Bren (JK Simmons and Allison Janney) she intends to have the baby and then hand it over for adoption. In the pages of the PennySaver, she finds childless couple Vanessa and Mark Loring (Jennifer Garner and Jason Bateman) who look like the ideal couple. But, as the months progress and her stomach swells, Juno begins to doubt both them and her course of action. Oscar-winning Diablo Cody's whip-smart script keeps the laughs coming and the action moving in one of the most lauded movies of recent years(n)

programme.desc: Beauty and the Beast. Happily Ever After always presents a non-traditional look at classic fairy tales. Children learn to look beneath the surface in the African-American version of Beauty and the Beast. An all-star cast populates this story, with Vanessa Williams playing Beauty, Gregory Hines as the Beast, and Paul Winfield playing the father. When Beauty must keep company with the Beast to save her father's life, she is surprised by her change of heart. She soon learns that true goodness can lie beneath a rough exterior. The video features "Could She, Would She, Will She" and "Wave Goodbye." This family friendly program is recommended for ages four to nine(n)

programme.title: Happily Ever After: Fairy Tales for Every Child
programme.desc: Snow White. HBO does it again with another addition to their multicultural fairy tale series Happily Ever After Fairy Tales for Every Child. This time, Snow White is a Native American princess White Snow. White Snow is indeed the fairest in the land, much to the chagrin of Sly Fox. Sly Fox summons her powers of dark magic to put a spell on White Snow. White Snow is found and protected by seven tiny turquoise miners. It sounds like the same old story, but these ethnic twists make it seem like an entirely new tale. The voices of Graham Greene and Buffy St. Marie also spruce up this tried and true classic(n)

programme.desc: A small-town teen's singing video goes viral and catapults her and her sister's band into global super stardom, but their newfound fame threatens to break apart their familial bonds(n)

Alex Gates is a wine seller who juggles his wife Suzanne, stepson Jason and his mistress Gabriella while at the same time plotting fiendish robberies. His latest, the theft of a valuable diamond necklace with expert safe-cracker Victor Spansky, proves to be the last straw for Suzanne and Jason, who decide to leave Alex behind for good. There's just one problem: they have accidentally taken the stolen necklace with them, and now Alex and Victor will stop at nothing to get it back(n)

programme.title: Ocean's Thirteen

The team plan to ruin the opening of his glitzy Las Vegas casino and hotel by rigging the games and ensuring that every punter goes home with a jackpot. programme.desc: Aspiring EDM musician Cole works to hone his craft, and is taken under the wing of a jaded, successful DJ named James. However, the friendship between the two men sours when Cole begins to fall for James' beautiful girlfriend(n)

programme.title: The Ruins
programme.desc: Gruesome horror about a group of American twentysomethings whose Mexican holiday takes a grisly turn. When a German holidaymaker begs the travellers to help find his brother, who went missing exploring an ancient Mayan temple, the group agrees to offer their assistance. Unfortunately, the mercy mission turns into a desperate fight for survival as the tourists discover that something deeply unpleasant is waiting for them in the ruins. Adapted from the novel by Scott B Smith(n)

programme.title: The Maze Runner: The Scorch Trials
programme.desc: In this pulse-pounding installment in the dystopian young-adult series, Thomas and the other Gladers journey across an obstacle-filled wasteland called the Scorch. Along the way, they search for information regarding the organization known as WCKD(n)

programme.desc: Billy Bob Thornton is hilarious in this deliciously warped holiday comedy from director Terry Zwigoff ("Ghost World"). Thornton plays a vulgar, boozy con artist who robs the department stores where he works as St. Nick(n)

programme.title: Scarface
programme.desc: A Cuban refugee becomes a drug lord in Miami. Inspired by actual events(n)

Trying to win himself back into favour, he latches on to tailor Geoffrey Rush, whose wife works for the government. Rush, reluctantly blackmailed into providing intelligence, offers Brosnan increasingly lurid stories which, embellished again and sent to London, create a political incident that begins to spiral out of control

programme.title: Rated A for Awesome
programme.sub-title: When Hall Freezes Over/Lost in Character.
programme.desc: Double bill. When the team awesomises the dreary weather by creating an indoor snow day at school, Lars is terrified that the legendary Yetis of Norg will show up to settle a generations-old score. Desperate to show her family she's a great party planner, Thera has the team transmogrified into superheroes for her little cousin's birthday. However, when she pushes Les too deep into character, he might never come back.

programme.title: Randy Cunningham: 9th Grade Ninja
programme.sub-title: Last Stall on the Left/Got Stank.
programme.desc: Double bill. New kid Randy Cunningham is the latest in a long line of ninjas who have protected Norrisville High School for 800 years. On his first day at school he faces danger. Randy and Howard try to get themselves into the cool seats for the school game by painting themselves with blue body paint.

programme.title: Wander Over Yonder
programme.desc: Double bill. Wander's celestial picnic distracts Lord Hater. Then, Wander and Sylvia end up as fugitives on a planet that Lord Hater is ruling.

programme.title: Dude, That's My Ghost
programme.desc: Double bill. Spencer loses his guitar-pick necklace and cannot see Billy any more. Billy is so desperate for attention he inadvertently convinces Hugh and Jane the house is haunted. Spencer enters a Halloween competition to find the best haunted house. The winner gets to work with a famous special effects director. Lolo is determined to thwart Spencer.

programme.title: Dude, That's My Ghost
programme.desc: Double bill. Spencer gets what he deserves when he cons Hugh into taking him on a camping trip so he can shoot a desert-themed horror movie.

programme.title: Kid vs Kat
programme.sub-title: Dial B for Babysitter/The Grass Is Always Meaner.
programme.desc: Double bill. Kat sabotages Old Lady Munson's efforts to earn money doing her gardening. Kat sees an opportunity to kill three birds with one stone when Old Lady Munson comes over to babysit with her dog, Growler.

programme.title: Kid vs Kat
programme.sub-title: Board Kat/The Treasure of Sierra Munson.
programme.desc: Double bill. Coop and Kat fight over the feline's new lightning bolt generator, and end up swapping brains. Then, the boy discovers there is buried treasure under Old Lady Munson's house.

programme.title: Randy Cunningham: 9th Grade Ninja
programme.desc: During McFist Industries' 50th anniversary celebrations the Ninja reveals McFist as a villain. Now his cover's blown, McFist can focus his power on destroying the Ninja.

programme.title: Randy Cunningham: 9th Grade Ninja
programme.desc: Randy and Howard accidentally stumble back in time and must help the original Ninja battle the Sorcerer.

programme.title: Boyster
programme.desc: Double bill. When Boyster is in danger, a third arm grows out of his head and saves him. Then, Boyster and Rafik decide to dig a swimming pool for the summer.

programme.title: Pair of Kings
programme.desc: The boys ignore warnings of bad karma and play lots of pranks when they realise the islanders are unaware of practical jokes, but strange things soon start to happen.

programme.title: Pair of Kings
programme.desc: Brady and Boomer have odd dreams about the mummy returning to take over the kingdom. When Mikayla and her father notice the medallion is missing, the twins set out to retrieve it.

programme.title: Phineas and Ferb
programme.sub-title: Phineas and Ferb and the Temple of Juatchadoon.
programme.desc: The boys travel through time to 1914, where they search for historical treasure.

programme.title: Phineas and Ferb
programme.desc: The boys discover an unfinished time machine and decide to complete it, while Dr Doofenshmirtz hatches a plan to transform the secret agents into statues. Candace is chased by dinosaurs in a prehistoric era, and when their time machine is smashed, the girls come to the rescue.

programme.title: Phineas and Ferb
programme.sub-title: Jerk de Soleil/Toy to the World.

programme.title: CBBC @ The Ten Pieces Prom
programme.desc: Transferring the magical world of the BBC Ten Pieces cinema film into an exciting and immersive Prom at the Royal Albert Hall, the BBC National Orchestra of Wales and conductor Thomas Sondergard are joined by firebirds and fast cars, magic mountains and mountain trolls, stormy seas and wicked witches, as they take the family audience on a journey through ten pieces of classical music. Presenters including Blue Peter's Barney Harwood, Dick and Dom, and Friday Download's Molly Rainford introduce Mozart's Horn Concerto, Mussorgsky's Night on a Bare Mountain and John Adams' Short Ride in a Fast Machine, the dancers of Trinity Laban perform Anna Meredith's striking body percussion piece Connect It and a massed children's choir of 450 sing Handel's Zadok The Priest. The creativity of the nation's children takes centre stage, as their extraordinary artwork and performances in response to the pieces are showcased on big screens and the lucky few perform live on stage with their own dances and compositions. With a lively soundtrack, all-round action, audience participation, a few surprises and a lot of fun along the way, this is the fitting culmination to the first year of the BBC's biggest ever music education initiative, one which has already engaged half of all the primary schools in the country.

With a party to organise the gang get to work - Matilda's brother Jack and sisters Megan and Holly take shopping to another level as they speed along the river Thames on a high-performance rib to pick up supplies. Matilda's in charge of the party food: build your own spicy sausage pitta bread sandwiches with zingy yoghurt sauce and popcorn cakes. The popcorn cakes idea came from Scarlet, a Matilda and the Ramsay Bunch viewer who emailed it to Matilda's Food Blog. Great food, friends and fun, and the party finishing with a bang when the guys play an explosive game with a watermelon - parties don't get much better!.(n)
